dish_viz Documentation

dish_viz: dish_viz

dish_viz

  • Homepage: http://ros.org/wiki/dish_viz

    • dish_viz is a ROS package for visualizing the activity of a neural network. Spikes and centers of activity are plotted in sync with the movement of the ARM, allowing for a visual representation of what is causing the movement. The package consists of a single node, and relies on the other packages in the arm_project stack to perform properly.

    Code API

    • Run the visualizer node by creating an DataHandler object.
    • To initialize the visualizer: DishVisualizer::init
    • To update voltage data for a channel: DishVisualizer::update
    • To update the center of activity: DishVisualizer::updateCa
    • To redraw the visualizer screen: DishVisualizer::redraw
    • To set volt ranges for each channel: DishVisualizer::setVoltRanges
    • To correct ranges: DishVisualizer::setMinVolt and DishVisualizer::setMaxVolt

    ROS API

    List of nodes:

    • dish_viz

    dish_viz

    dish_viz receives dish states from a receiver node and then plots that activity on screen for the user to see. It also receives centers of activity from the CAT creator node and plots those as well. This node is in sync with the movements of the ARM.

    Usage

    $ rosrun dish_viz dish_viz

    ROS topics

    Subscribes to:

    • "dish_states_to_dish_viz": [neuro_recv/dish_state] incoming dish states
    • "cas": [neuro_recv/ca] incoming centers of activity
    • "bursts_to_dish_viz": [neuro_recv/burst] used to signal start of playback
    • "ranges_to_dish_viz": [neuro_recv/ranges] used for color calculation

    Publishes to:

    • N/A

    ROS parameters

    Reads the following parameters from the parameter server

    • loop_rate
    • visualizer_color_mode

    Sets the following parameters on the parameter server

    • N/A

    ROS services

    • "time_service": [time_server/time_srv] polls system time to keep the node in sync
